Package rosterfiles

Class RosterManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • rosterfiles.RosterManager
  • public class RosterManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class reads input from command line and takes a series of different options such as adding a student, removing a student, changing a major, and printing students in different ways.
    Author:
    Anis Chihoub, Aryan Jairath

    • Method Detail

      • isOneChar

        private boolean isOneChar​(java.lang.String command)
        This method checks is the command is a one letter command from the valid options except P, which is checked for in the following method.
        Parameters:
        command - a string representing a command
        Returns:
        a boolean, true if the command is valid. False otherwise

      • isTwoChars

        private boolean isTwoChars​(java.lang.String command)
        This method checks is the command is a two letter command. Since two letter commands can start with a P, we check for the P command as well as PS and PC.
        Parameters:
        command - a string representing a command
        Returns:
        a boolean, true if the command is valid. False otherwise

      • checkInvalid

        private boolean checkInvalid​(java.lang.String command)
        This method receives a string containing a command and checks if it is valid based on the ruleset provided in the writeup.
        Parameters:
        command - : a string containing a command read in from the scanner class.
        Returns:
        a boolean, indicating if the command is valid or not.

      • wasNYearsAgo

        private Date wasNYearsAgo​(int nYears)
        This method checks the date n years ago from today
        Parameters:
        nYears - An integer representing the number of years ago from today to calculate the date
        Returns:
        A date object representing the date n years ago

      • isInteger

        public static boolean isInteger​(java.lang.String checkCredit)
        This method validates if the input number is an integer
        Parameters:
        checkCredit - a String representing an integer to be checked
        Returns:
        a boolean value, true if the value is an integer, otherwise false

      • isValidMajor

        public static boolean isValidMajor​(java.lang.String testMajor)
        This method checks if an input string qualifies as a valid major based on enum class
        Parameters:
        testMajor - A string that is being checked for whether it is a major or not
        Returns:
        A boolean value returning true if the string parameter is a valid major

      • isValidSchool

        public static boolean isValidSchool​(java.lang.String testSchool)
        This method checks if an input string is a valid school
        Parameters:
        testSchool - A string that is being checked for whether it is an existing school or not
        Returns:
        A boolean value returning true if the string parameter is a valid school

      • makeStudent

        private Student makeStudent​(java.lang.String[] parsedCommand)
        Makes a student object. Checks for invalid conditions and prints out if there is an issue.
        Parameters:
        parsedCommand - an Array of Strings where each index contains student information as an individual String
        Returns:
        an object of type Student after making it based on the parsed input and checking if it can be a valid student for the roster

      • executeA

        private void executeA​(java.lang.String[] parsedCommand)
        Executes a command of type A, given a parsed student information.
        Parameters:
        parsedCommand - , an Array of Strings where each index contains student information as an individual String

      • executeR

        private void executeR​(java.lang.String[] parsedCommand)
        This method executes the R command, which removes a provided student. Prints out an error message if there is no valid student.
        Parameters:
        parsedCommand - an array of Strings containing the tokenized command.

      • executeL

        private void executeL​(java.lang.String[] parsedCommand)
        This method is in response to the L command which prints students by a specified school
        Parameters:
        parsedCommand - an array of Strings containing the tokenized command

      • executeC

        private void executeC​(java.lang.String[] parsedCommand)
        This method changes the major of specified student as picked intended by the input
        Parameters:
        parsedCommand - an array of Strings containing the tokenized command

      • executeCommand

        public void executeCommand​(java.lang.String[] parsedCommand)
        This method executes a command based on the string input.
        Parameters:
        parsedCommand - an array of strings containing the parsed command

      • run

        public void run()
        This method runs the tuition manager by listening for commands. This is done using the scanner class and parsing the string input. In addition, we check for invalid input using the checkInvalid method.
